name: Mount Mansfield

trails_config.name: Sunset Ridge Trail
trails_config.description: The most classic route in Vermont. Ascends a wide, exposed bedrock ridge for nearly a mile, offering constant sunset views over Lake Champlain and the Adirondacks.
trails_config.parking_info: Underhill State Park, Mountain Rd, Underhill, VT

trails_config.name: Long Trail South via Smugglers Notch
trails_config.description: A rugged climb from the historic Smugglers' Notch. Features caves, wooden ladders, and a steep ascent to the Adam's Apple and the Chin.

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of Vermont on Mount Mansfield. At 4393 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4393 feet, Mount Mansfield is a standout peak in Vermont. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Sunset Ridge Trail**, a **6.6 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

This peak stands relatively isolated, offering a solitary summit experience.

trails.name: Long Trail South via Smugglers Notch
